tit.e: Teiseihakushu (Japanese sake with low rice polishing rate)

sen.j: 低精白酒（ていせいはくしゅ）とは、2005年ごろ開発された日本酒の一種である。
sen.e: Teiseihakushu is a kind of Japanese sake developed in around 2005.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Teiseihakushu is a kind of Japanese sake developed around 2005.

sen.j: おもに精米歩合80％前後の日本酒純米種のことである。
sen.e: It mainly indicates the junmaishu (sake made without added alcohol) with the rice-polishing ratio of about 80 percent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It mainly refers to Nihonshu Junmaishu (sake made without added alcohol or sugar) with the rice-polishing ratio of about 80 percent.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました単語の形式を統一しました用語の補足を登録用語のとおりに修正しました
sen.e: It mainly refers to Nihonshu Junmaishu (sake made without added alcohol or sugar) with the rice-polishing ratio of about 80 percent.

sen.j: それ以前は、純米酒は精米歩合70％以下と決まっていた。
sen.e: Before 2005, the rice-polishing ratio was stipulated as 70 percent or lower.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Before then, the rice-polishing ratio was set at 70 percent or lower.
Before then, the rice-polishing ratio was set at 70 percent or lower.

sen.j: 75％を超えると日本酒普通酒なみの低い酒質を生むとされていた。
sen.e: It was considered that low quality sake equivalent to Nihonshu Futsushu (ordinary sake) was produced with the polishing ratio of 75 percent or higher.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was considered that low quality sake equivalent to Nihonshu Futsushu (ordinary quality sake) was produced with the polishing ratio of 75 percent or higher.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました用語の補足を登録用語のとおりに修正しました
sen.e: It was considered that low quality sake equivalent to Nihonshu Futsushu (ordinary quality sake) was produced with the polishing ratio of 75 percent or higher.

sen.j: それ以上の精米歩合は軽んじられてきた。
sen.e: So the polishing ratios of 75 percent or higher were thought little of.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: So the polishing ratios of 75 percent or higher were thought little of.
So the polishing ratios of 75 percent or higher were thought little of.

sen.j: だが、あえてその逆を追及した酒種ともいえる。
sen.e: However, it can be said that teiseihakushu is a kind of sake daringly aimed at producing sake with just opposite method.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it can be said that teiseihakushu is a kind of sake daringly pursued in the opposite direction.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました原文は正しくは「追求」です
sen.e: However, it can be said that teiseihakushu is a kind of sake daringly pursued in the opposite direction.

sen.j: 米ほんらいの素朴な風味と旨みを特徴とする。
sen.e: It has a feature of simple flavor and umami (taste) that rice has originally has.
It has a feature of simple flavor and umami (taste) which rice originally has.

sen.j: 日本酒を造るために、酒米は精米すればするほど、完成酒の雑味の原因となる米粒の周囲の部分が取り除かれる。
sen.e: The more sakamai (rice for brewing sake) is polished, the more part around the rice grain that is cause of zatsumi (unfavorable taste for sake) is got rid of.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the making of sake, the more sakamai (rice for brewing sake) is polished, the more part around the rice grain which is cause of zatsumi (unfavorable taste of sake) is got rid of.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ文法を修正しました
sen.e: In the making of sake, the more sakamai (rice for brewing sake) is polished, the more part around the rice grain which is cause of zatsumi (unfavorable taste of sake) is got rid of.

sen.j: 中心部の酒米構造（しんぱく）だけになっていく。
sen.e: In the end the rice grain becomes only shinpaku (the center structure of sake-brewing-rice).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the end only shinpaku (the center structure of sake-brewing-rice) is left.

sen.j: 日本酒吟醸酒を初めとする高級酒の製造には、こうした高度な精米技術、すなわち低い精米歩合は必須とされる。
sen.e: In order to produce the high-class sake including nihonshu ginjoshu (high-quality sake brewed at low temperatures from rice grains milled to 60 % weight or less), it is considered that such high level rice-polishing technique, that is, low rice-polishing ratio, is indispensable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In order to produce the high-class sake including Nihonshu Ginjoshu (high-quality sake brewed at low temperatures from rice grains milled to 60 % weight or less), it is considered that such high level rice-polishing technique, that is, low rice-polishing ratio, is indispensable.
sen.cmt: 単語の形式を統一しました
sen.e: In order to produce the high-class sake including Nihonshu Ginjoshu (high-quality sake brewed at low temperatures from rice grains milled to 60 % weight or less), it is considered that such high level rice-polishing technique, that is, low rice-polishing ratio, is indispensable.

sen.j: 今では精米歩合30％台の高級酒もめずらしくなくなった。
sen.e: Nowadays, high-class sake with polishing ration of 30 percent is not unusual.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nowadays, high-class sake with polishing ration of 30 percent is not rare.

sen.j: しかし1930年代に縦型精米機が登場する以前は、日本酒は低い精米技術、すなわち高い精米歩合の酒米で造られていた。
sen.e: However, until a vertical-type rice-milling machine had been developed in 1930's, sake was produced with low level rice polishing technique, that is, with sakamai (rice for brewing sake) of high polishing ratio.
However, before a vertical-type rice-milling machine which was developed in 1930's, sake was produced with low level rice polishing technique, that is, with sakamai of high polishing ratio.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました既出の補足説明を削除しました
sen.e: However, before a vertical-type rice-milling machine which was developed in 1930's, sake was produced with low level rice polishing technique, that is, with sakamai of high polishing ratio.

sen.j: その意味で、もともと日本酒が持っていた昔の良さを探究しているともいえる。
sen.e: In that sense, it can be said that teiseihakushu has been developed to seek the original goodness of sake in old days.
In that sense, it can be also said that teiseihakushu has been developed to seek the good old taste which sake originally had.

sen.j: また、純米酒の精米歩合をめぐる法規制として、平成15年（2003年）までは「精米歩合が70％以下のもの」という項目があった。
sen.e: And as for regulations about the polishing ratio of junmaishu (sake made without added alcohol or sugar), there was a provision until 2003 that said 'junmaishu shall be made with polishing ratio of 70 percent or less.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: だが、平成16年（2004年）以降それが削除されたため、こうした酒種の開発が可能になった。
sen.e: But as the provision has been eliminated in and after 2004, such kind of sake can be produced.

sen.e: But, as the provision has been eliminated in 2004, it became possible to produce these kind of sake.

sen.j: また、日本酒を「米だけで造ったワイン（rice wine）」として喜ぶ海外市場をターゲットにした側面もある。
sen.e: In addition, the sake has been produced partly with a view to obtaining the customers in overseas market who are pleased with the sake dubbed as 'made from only rice (rice wine).'
In addition, the sake has been produced partly with a view to obtaining the customers in overseas market who are pleased with sake as 'wine made from only rice (rice wine).'
